result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcell L Hall

records.addlTxt: Order GRANTING Defendant privileges to view digital discovery signed and filed.  bm

Defendant Marcell L Hall not in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in court for Marcell L Hall.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Marcell L Hall.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Final Pretrial this date.  Parties make joint request for adjournment of trial to allow the State time to prepare.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 27, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcell L Hall in court with attorney Melissa Fitzsimmons and Katherine Graber.  Defendant Marcell L Hall in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Final Pretrial held.  Defense previously filed motion to adjourn.  Court grants request and vacates July 18th jury trial date.  
  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Witness List.  Received and Filed.  nk
State's Motion in Limine.  Received and Filed.  nk
Motion to Adjourn Trial Date.  Received and Filed.  nk
Notice of Intent to use DNA Evidence at Trial.  Received and Filed.  nk
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm
Order Granting stipulation to sever cases for trial signed and filed.  bm

Defendant Marcell L Hall in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Marcell L Hall in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  State moves to sever this matter from Co-Defendant's case (22CF129) based on possible resolutions.  No objection by Defense.  Court grants request.  State to draft an order.  Defense requests a Final Pretrial and Jury Trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcell L Hall in court with Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons; both appear by video.  Defendant Marcell L Hall in custody.  Jennifer Tate appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective T. Keller. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  This hearing will be streamed live on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqYxLDHV-xN_RkKf_fE1jjw  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with WH dob 5/29/2006 DC dob 9/10/1963
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring: no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marcell L Hall in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Marcell L Hall in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marcell L Hall appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
